Sequence Information.Peptide Name: 4324(derived from the RNase H domain of HIV-1 RT (20-mes))
Sequence Information.Source: Synthetic construct(derived from HIV-1 Reverse Transcriptase)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.15790559]HIV-1:the level of peptide binding to HIV integrase is high.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: Two viral encoded enzymes(reverse transcriptase and integrase) play central roles in the early stages of the replication of retroviruses and retrotransposons.The peptide derived from the RNase H domain of HIV-1 RT inhibits integrase-associated activities (3â€²-end processing and strand transfer) and inhibit virus replication.

Literature.Title: Peptides derived from the reverse transcriptase of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 as novel inhibitors of the viral integrase.
Literature.Author: Oz Gleenberg I, Avidan O, Goldgur Y, Herschhorn A, Hizi A.
